title: Rachmaninov: Works for Cello and Piano - Krijgh, Amara (2015)
description:
SERGE RACHMANINOV (1873-1943)
Works for Cello & Piano

pizzicato.lu (Luxembourg) [2016-01-28]:
Sensitive Interpreters of Rachmaninov

"Dutch cellist Harriet Krijgh ( 1991 ), together with Russian pianist Magda Amara, play a very lively, yet at the same time very sensitive, profound and warmhearted interpretation of Sergei Rachmaninov's cello sonata opus 19. Deep feelings, fine nuancing without emotionalism or too much sweetness; Nothing is compromised here, also not in the playing of the pianist, who gives shape to the frequently virtuoso piano part in an exceptionally transparent way, so that the cello very rarely, and if so only slightly, retreats to the background. Besides the cello sonata smaller pieces were heard, including the famous "Vocalise", an "Elegie", and the Romance opus 4/3. Here once again both interpreters play with great verve and large imagination."

Sonata for cello and piano in G minor Op. 19
01. I. Lento - Allegro moderato [13.36]
02. II. Allegro scherzando [06.28]
03. III. Andante [05.58]
04. IV. Allegro mosso [10.46]
05. Ã‰lÃ©gie (from "Morceaux de fantasia", Op. 3 No, 1) [05.50]
06. Vocalise (from "Songs", Op. 34 No. 14) [06.57]
07. Romance Op. 4 No. 3 (In the silence of the secret night) [03.06]
Total Playing Time: 52:41

Harriet Krijgh, cello (Giovanni Paolo Maggini)
Magda Amara, piano (Steinway&Sons D)

Recording: Raiding (Austria), Liszt-Konzerthalle May 2015
Engineer and musical supervisor: Wolfgang Steininger
